page.title: 12The White Hart, Wytham.
page.content: The 15th century village pub is called "The White Hart". It stands at the centre of the village, close to the church and the village shop, its old stone walls and tiled roof, with several gables, adding to the picturesque appearance of the village. In the courtyard behind the pub is an old dovecot now used for a wood store. "The White Hart" is owned by Halls Brewery and is one of the well-known pubs in the area. Three miles from the centre of Oxford it is a very popular student pub, a favourite lunching place for local businessmen and academics, the haunt of tourists in the summer and the accepted meeting place for the 'regulars'. The walled garden with its wrought iron gates, the converted barn, the stone-flagged floor and the huge open fireplace in the bar add charm to this village pub.
